unnormalised: ## New Wheels Alert! What's Rolling Out of the Auto Garages?
normalised: ## New Wheels Alert! What's Rolling Out of the Auto Garages?

unnormalised: Hey Petrolheads! Buckle up, because the Indian automotive scene is hotter than a Mumbai summer right now! We've got a flurry of new vehicle launches to keep you drooling and planning that next big road trip from Delhi to Leh.
normalised: Hey Petrolheads! Buckle up, because the Indian automotive scene is hotter than a Mumbai summer right now! We've got a flurry of new vehicle launches to keep you drooling and planning that next big road trip from Delhi to Leh.

unnormalised: First off, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the much-awaited next-gen Alto 800. They're promising better mileage – something every Indian driver appreciates with those rising petrol prices – and a fresher design. Think "Student of the Year" makeover, but for your daily commute. Price is expected to be around Rs. 4 Lakhs, making it a tempting option for first-time car buyers.
normalised: First off, Maruti Suzuki finally unveiled the much-awaited next-generation Alto eight hundred. They're promising better mileage – something every Indian driver appreciates with those rising petrol prices – and a fresher design. Think "Student of the Year" makeover, but for your daily commute. Price is expected to be around rupee four lakhs, making it a tempting option for first-time car buyers.

unnormalised: Then there's Mahindra, teasing us with glimpses of their new Thar 5-door. This beast is supposed to be a proper off-roader, perfect for conquering the rough terrains of Rajasthan. They've apparently collaborated with IIT Delhi on the suspension system, so expect a smoother ride, even when you're battling potholes bigger than craters! Launch date is rumored to be around Diwali, and bookings are already open.
normalised: Then there's Mahindra, teasing us with glimpses of their new Thar five-door. This beast is supposed to be a proper off-roader, perfect for conquering the rough terrains of Rajasthan. They've apparently collaborated with I I T Delhi on the suspension system, so expect a smoother ride, even when you're battling potholes bigger than craters! Launch date is rumored to be around Diwali, and bookings are already open.

unnormalised: Tata Motors isn't sleeping either! They're planning to launch an updated version of the Nexon EV, boasting a longer range of approximately 450 km. This could finally ease the range anxiety that’s been holding many back from embracing electric.
normalised: Tata Motors isn't sleeping either! They're planning to launch an updated version of the Nexon E V, boasting a longer range of approximately four hundred and fifty kilometer. This could finally ease the range anxiety that’s been holding many back from embracing electric.

unnormalised: And let’s not forget the two-wheeler market! Hero MotoCorp is set to unleash a new 150cc bike targeting the youth. Expect sporty styling and a competitive price point to take on the likes of Bajaj and TVS.
normalised: And let’s not forget the two-wheeler market! Hero MotoCorp is set to unleash a new one hundred and fifty c c bike targeting the youth. Expect sporty styling and a competitive price point to take on the likes of Bajaj and T V S.

unnormalised: So, there you have it – a quick rundown of the exciting launches hitting the Indian market. Which one are you most excited about? Let us know in the comments! Happy driving, doston!
normalised: So, there you have it – a quick rundown of the exciting launches hitting the Indian market. Which one are you most excited about? Let us know in the comments! Happy driving, doston!
